business.headline: Sufficient stock, India won't face immediate oil disruption amid Iran crisisIndia imports 88 per cent of its crude oil – the raw material for making fuels like petrol and diesel – and about half of its requirement for natural gas - the feedstock for generating electricity, producing fertiliser, fuel for household kitchens and CNG for automobiles – and cooking gas LPG.

India built UPI and Aadhaar, is it time for an Aatmanirbhar credit score too?A three-digit number may look small on paper. But for millions of Indians, it quietly decides how far they can go. India built digital infrastructure for identity (AADHAAR) and payment (UPI). The next question is whether credit deserves the same clarity and control.

Warner Bros Discovery signs $110 billion deal with Paramount SkydanceWarner Bros Discovery agreed to a $110 billion acquisition by Paramount Skydance after Netflix declined to match the offer, creating a media powerhouse set to reshape Hollywood and streaming competition.

From FDs to mutual funds: How Indians are changing their investment behaviourFor years, FDs and real estate were the first choice for Indian savers seeking safety and certainty. Now, mutual funds are steadily gaining popularity, especially among first-time investors looking for higher returns. Is this the beginning of a long-term shift in how Indians invest?

India's Q3 GDP grows 7.8% as government rolls out new base year seriesThe Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation introduced a new series of GDP estimates with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the earlier 2011-12 base.

Sensex, Nifty fall over 1% as global worries mount; auto, financial shares tankThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.

Pakistan to run short of flour? Wheat output likely to fall amid Afghanistan warAccording to a report by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Pakistan's wheat production is expected to decline by 2 to 2.2 million tonnes compared to last year.

Including property in your will? Here's how to avoid family and legal conflictsA house is often the most valuable thing people leave behind. Yet, without proper details in a Will, like ownership clarity, liabilities, and documentation, it can become the very reason families face delays and disagreements instead of closure. Is your Will detailed enough to prevent that?

Why India's growing wealth is driving investment into luxury real estateAs capital increases, investors become more careful. The focus shifts from chasing returns to protecting value. This is why luxury real estate is gaining importance in serious portfolios.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Time to invest, hold or sell?Silver shot up by over Rs 8,000, marking a fresh high in recent trading. With momentum high but volatility looming, the big question is: is it time to invest or sell?

What are Life Cycle Funds and how can they make your retirement planning easier?Life cycle funds are designed to adjust their asset allocation automatically as an investor moves closer to a specific goal, usually retirement.

Sensex closes 961 points lower: Why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.  Both indices lost over 1%.

Block's 4,000 job cuts: Why layoffs are no longer a sign of crisisBlock said it would cut more than 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, reducing staff from over 10,000 to just under 6,000. This was not a company in distress. It was a company growing.
Sensex opens 277 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Infosys up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.29 points to 81,866.32, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 154.55 points to 25,342.00 as of 9:50 am.

Rs 583 crore returned, full-page ads out – is IDFC First Bank's trust push enough?IDFC First Bank's response offers a rare test of corporate accountability. But will a quick refund and bold messaging be enough to turn a damaging crisis into a chance to rebuild trust? We spoke to experts to understand what real recovery will demand.

Netflix calls Warner deal not attractive, clears path for ParamountNetflix declined to raise its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount's $31-per-share takeover offer that could reshape Hollywood and trigger major antitrust scrutiny.

Earning Rs 30 lakh a year but little wealth? Why many DINK couples fall behindWith two salaries and no childcare costs, DINK couples are often seen as having a clear financial advantage. Yet many high-earning couples find their wealth growing slower than expected. Is lifestyle inflation quietly eroding their investment potential?

India, Israel sign MoU to link UPI systems, boost digital payment tiesThe integration is expected to help Indian and Israeli businesses and individuals carry out financial transactions more easily. It could also reduce transaction costs and processing time, making payments faster and more convenient.

World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende quits amid probe into Epstein tiesBorge Brende, President and CEO of the World Economic Forum, has stepped down amid scrutiny over his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.

entertainment.headline: Ram Charan begins dubbing for Peddi, shares fun studio video Ram Charan has started dubbing for the sports drama, Peddi, with the production team assuring audiences that the film will release worldwide on April 30, 2026 in multiple languages.

Rashmika-Vijay's first ad after wedding: Fans can't keep calm seeing the chemistry Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's first advertisement campaign together since their wedding is trending online. The chemistry the two actors share has captivated fans.

Ajith Kumar stranded in Dubai amid airspace shutdown, manager confirms he is safe Actor Ajith Kumar is currently unable to return to Chennai due to flight cancellations in Dubai, following the escalation of conflict between Israel and Iran. His manager has confirmed his safety.
Actor Sonal Chauhan, stranded in Dubai, says she's safe Sonal Chauhan assured fans she is safe in Dubai after being stranded due to flight cancellations amid tension in the Middle East.

Newlyweds Rashmika-Vijay seek blessings at Tirupati temple, distribute sweets Newly-wed Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna sought blessings at Tirumala Temple in Hyderabad and distributed sweets to devotees on Sunday, marking the start of a series of nationwide celebrations.

Sutapa Sikdar remembers Irrfan on anniversary, recalls his wish to marry again Sutapa Sikdar remembered late actor Irrfan on their wedding anniversary with an emotional note, recalling why they chose their wedding date and his wish to remarry after 25 years.

Rajpal Yadav's lawyer says complainant acted out of revenge, wanted him jailed Rajpal Yadav's lawyer accused businessman Madhav Gopal Agarwal of targeting the actor out of revenge in the Rs 9 crore loan case.

Prabhas to Vijay Deverakonda: Is scale swallowing the soul in Telugu films? From pan-India stars like Prabhas and Allu Arjun  to local gods like Nani and Vijay Devarakonda, the obsession for scale and spectacle has made the traditional family entertainer a rare spectacle in Telugu cinema.

Jack White to Mark Ruffalo, Hollywood celebs react to US-Israel strikes on Iran Several Hollywood celebrities, including Jack White, John Cusack, Mark Ruffalo and Carrie Coon, reacted on social media to the US and Israel's military strikes on Iran.

Shefali Shah on gender roles: Being equal to men is not an agenda Shefali Shah called for equal parenting responsibility, stressing that fathers play a crucial role in shaping children's values and respect towards women.

Actor Vishnu Manchu shares missile visuals from Dubai: No child should hear war Vishnu Manchu shared a disturbing video of missiles lighting up the Dubai sky amid rising Middle East tensions. He revealed that the loud interceptions frightened his daughter.

Ali Fazal-Richa Chadha dial up chemistry with 'sleepover' talk, cute poses Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal delighted fans with a heartwarming social media exchange as Ali cheered her on for the first day of her new project.

The Kerala Story 2 box office Day 2: Film crosses Rs 5 crore after decent Saturday The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond saw a strong jump in box office collections on Day 2 after a delayed release, taking its total to Rs 5.40 crore.

Actor Sonal Chauhan appeals to PM Modi after being stranded in Dubai Indian citizens, including actor Sonal Chauhan and athlete PV Sindhu, are left stranded at Dubai airport following flight cancellations due to escalating tensions in the Middle East. Chauhan urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi for help.

Police file closure report in Vashu Bhagnani's FIR against Ali Abbas Zafar, others Mumbai police have filed a closure report in producer Vashu Bhagnani's FIR against director Ali Abbas Zafar, pertaining to their 2024 film, Bade Miyan Chote Miyan.

Rashmika-Vijay's pan-India wedding celebration plan: Annadanam, sweet distribution Actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to mark their wedding by distributing sweets across major Indian cities and organising Annadanam at temples. Amidst their personal celebration, they wish to thank their supporters.
Toxic: New Tabaahi song poster hints at Yash-Kiara's quiet romance A fresh poster for the song Tabaahi, featuring Yash and Kiara Advani, has been unveiled. The song is set for release on March 2.

Protests disrupt The Kerala Story 2 screenings in parts of Kerala The release of The Kerala Story 2 ran into fresh trouble in Kerala as protests over its depiction of forced religious conversions led to disrupted shows and cancellations across several districts. The film hit theatres on February 27.

New viral pics: Rashmika's doli entry, Vijay's royal dagger steal spotlight Fresh pictures emerging from the wedding of actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have gone viral on social media in no time. Check them out here.

general news.headline: Live: 8 killed in Israel, fresh explosions in Dubai, Abu Dhabi as Iran rains fireUS-Israel's Iran Strikes Live Updates: Iran on Sunday confirmed that Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed at his office in US–Israeli strikes on Tehran, a development that marks a major escalation in the conflict that began on Saturday. The claim followed coordinated attacks by the US and Israel, with Israel saying the US-led operation — codenamed Epic Fury — involved pre-emptive strikes. US President Donald Trump confirmed a "major combat operation" as explosions were reported across Iran. Tehran, which vowed a "crushing" response to the strikes, targeted US bases across the Middle East, including in the UAE, Bahrain, Qatar and Jordan. Several countries in the region shut their airspace, while governments issued advisories urging citizens to stay indoors and avoid unnecessary movement. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Khamenei killing, Iran's retaliation push Middle East to brink of all-out warThe US-Israeli strikes that killed Iran's Supreme Leader have triggered Tehran's missile retaliation across the region, sharply escalating hostilities and raising fears of a wider Middle East war.

IND vs WI Live Score: WI (13/0 in 2 ov). Hope attacks Hardik PandyaIndia (IND) vs West Indies (WI) Live Score, T20 World Cup: WI (13/0 in 2 overs). Shai Hope targetted Hardik Pandya to collect 10 runs after a steady first over from Arshdeep Singh. Roston Chase is feeling the pressure. Can India strike early?

Pak erupts over Khamenei's killing, US consulates attacked, UN office torchedAnger over Iran Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei's killing in US-Israeli strikes triggered unrest across Pakistan. Protesters attacked the US Consulate in Karachi, burned a UN office and held rallies in major cities.

Insurance mis-selling hits families. But regulators kept ignoring it for yearsIt has taken India decades to see the seriousness and scale of insurance mis-selling for what it is. We tell you the stories of some people who suffered because of it, and why the problem was allowed to go unchecked for so long.

Son of Ukrainian crime boss kidnapped in Bali, chilling ransom video surfacesA 28-year-old Ukrainian tourist, Igor Komarov, allegedly the son of a crime figure, has been kidnapped in Bali, with a chilling $10 million ransom video surfacing days after his disappearance.

Shoaib Malik denies fourth marriage rumours, says wife Sana targeted by trollsFormer Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik denied rumours of a fourth marriage and condemned online misinformation. He warned of legal consequences for those spreading defamatory content affecting his family.

Senior cleric Ayatollah Arafi named interim Supreme Leader after Khamenei killingBorn in 1959, the 67-year-old Ayatollah Alireza Arafi is a senior figure in Iran's clerical hierarchy. Before his interim leadership role, he held several key posts at once. He heads Iran's national network of Islamic seminaries, serves as a clerical member of the Guardian Council and sits on the Assembly of Experts.

Video: Woman who lit cigarette with burning Khamenei photo celebrates his deathThe woman had previously drawn global attention when footage showed her setting fire to a printed image of Khamenei and using it to relight a cigarette.

Return to your senses, your war is not with neighbours: UAE President warns IranPresident Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan slammed Iran for targeting several provinces of the United Arab Emirates with its missiles.

Indian-crewed tanker hit off Oman coast amid fresh Israel-Iran strikes; 4 injuredAn oil tanker was hit near Oman's Musandam peninsula as US-Israel strikes drew retaliatory attack from Iran, escalating tensions in Middle East. The crew comprised 15 Indians and five Iranian nationals.

Muslim-majority Murshidabad, Malda see highest number of voters pending SIR scrutinyWest Bengal's Murshidabad has 11.01 lakh voters, the highest, whose documents are still pending scrutiny, followed by Malda with 8.28 lakh, according to the final electoral rolls published by the Election Commission after the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise.

Rashmika-Vijay's first ad after wedding: Fans can't keep calm seeing the chemistryRashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's first advertisement campaign together since their wedding is trending online. The chemistry the two actors share has captivated fans.

Unite your forces to overthrow the regime: Netanyahu's new message for IraniansWhile stating that regime change was not an official military objective, Benjamin Netanyahu said ongoing strikes could create conditions for Iranians to take control of their future amid escalating regional tensions.

ICAI CA Final January 2026 results declared, merit list out. Check direct linksICAI CA Final January 2026 results have been declared today, March 1. Candidates who appeared for Group 1 and Group 2 exams can now check their scorecards, merit list and All India Rank holders on the official website, icai.nic.in. Direct result link is now active.

North India to stay hot and dry on Monday, cool morning to bring respiteIndia will face rising temperatures and cool mornings tomorrow. The IMD predicts a four to seven degrees Celsius rise in Northwest India.

When cricket took a backseat as cringe ads and influencers took overT20 World Cup: This is not about influencers versus journalists. It is about why access is being decided by follower count instead of understanding of the game.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Dubai airport, iconic Burj Al Arab hotel damaged in Iranian missile strikesOne of the terminals at the airport, normally one of the world's busiest aviation hubs, was damaged during an overnight Iranian attack that authorities publicly referred to only as an "incident."

Khamenei's cynical murder violated human morality norms: Putin's message to IranIran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, 86, was killed on Saturday following a large-scale military offensive carried out by Israel and the United States across the Islamic nation.

China races to land humans on Moon as Nasa revamps Artemis. Know moreChina announces steady advances in its crewed Moon mission with successful tests on lunar spacecraft, and a detailed 2026 space station schedule.

12 killed in Karachi as American troopers at US consulate fire at pro-Khamenei mobProtests erupted in Karachi and Lahore following the killing of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in joint US-Israel strikes, triggering anger among Shia groups across the city. Authorities used tear gas and imposed road closures as security forces prevented protesters from reaching the diplomatic mission.

Fresh blasts in Doha, Dubai as Iran vows most ferocious op against US, Israel basesExplosions were reported over Dubai and Doha for a second day as Iran launched retaliatory strikes targeting US-linked facilities across Gulf states following American and Israeli attacks on Iran.
Trump issues tit-for-tat warning for Iran, vows to use 'never seen before force'The warning came after the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps said that the murderers of Khamenei would be punished.

sports.headline: Sikandar Raza heroics in vain as rampaging South Africa storm into semis unbeaten T20 World Cup, SA vs ZIM: South Africa beat Zimbabwe by five wickets in New Delhi to continue their unbeaten run in the tournament. Sikandar Raza put in an incredible all-round showing, but it wasn't enough for Zimbabwe to win.

Alyssa Healy's farewell spectacle hands India crushing 0-3 whitewash in ODI series Australia completed a dominant 3-0 sweep over India in the Women's ODI series at Hobart. Alyssa Healy's spectacular century marked her ODI farewell, while India struggled against the relentless Australian attack.

Shoaib Malik denies fourth marriage rumours, says wife Sana targeted by trolls Former Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik denied rumours of a fourth marriage and condemned online misinformation. He warned of legal consequences for those spreading defamatory content affecting his family.

IND vs WI Live Score: WI (3/0 in 1 ov). Arshdeep bowls a tidy first over India (IND) vs West Indies (WI) Live Score, T20 World Cup: Roston Chase has replaced Brandon King at the top. He is opening with Shai Hope. Arshdeep Singh has the new ball for India. Earlier, India won the toss and opted to field in the virtual quarterfinal at Eden Gardens.

Watch: Stuck in Dubai, PV Sindhu shares update amid West Asia crisis PV Sindhu shared her first video from Dubai after being stranded due to the Iran attacks. She revealed an explosion occurred close to where she and her team were taking shelter at the airport.

Bairstow pleads for help as England Lions stranded in Dubai due to crisis Star England cricketer Jonny Bairstow has made an urgent plea for help after the England Lions squad was stranded in the United Arab Emirates amid escalating conflict in the Middle East.

India will play fire with fire vs West Indies: Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate T20 World Cup: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate emphasised that the side won't leave any stones unturned against West Indies during their upcoming T20 World Cup clash. The two sides will face each other in Kolkata in a fight for a semi-final spot.

Shree Charani sets embarrassing ODI record for India with horror spell against Australia INDW vs AUSW, 3rd ODI: Shree Charani bowled the most expensive spell by an Indian spinner in ODIs with figures of 10-0-106-2 against Australia on Sunday at the Bellerive Oval in Hobart.

Should India give Bumrah the new ball? Dinesh Karthik urges key tweak for WI clash T20 World Cup: Dinesh Karthik urged India to hand Jasprit Bumrah the new ball. He believes early wickets from Bumrah could disrupt West Indies' power-hitters and shape India's chances in their must-win Super 8 clash.

Watch: Starc beams with pride as wife Healy scores 158 in stunning ODI farewell Australia vs India: Veteran Australian pacer Mitchell Starc could not hide his pride on Sunday as his wife Alyssa Healy signed off from ODI cricket in grand style, smashing a breathtaking 158 against India in Hobart.

Don't call it Pakistan's team: Ex-batter's scathing attack after T20 World Cup exitICC T20 World Cup: Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali launched a strong attack on team management following Pakistan's early exit from the ongoing ICC tournament.

When cricket took a backseat as cringe ads and influencers took overT20 World Cup: This is not about influencers versus journalists. It is about why access is being decided by follower count instead of understanding of the game.

England Lions vs Pakistan Shaheens called off amid UAE security concernsThe ECB has cancelled the England Lions' second 50-over match in Abu Dhabi due to escalating security concerns in the Middle East. The situation has also delayed England Women's tour, although the senior men's team will continue with their T20 World Cup plans as scheduled

Don't make the Washington Sundar mistake: Ex-India cricketer wants unchanged XI vs WIT20 World Cup: Aakash Chopra warned India against tinkering with their Playing XI now. He stressed stability over experimentation ahead of the must-win clash vs West Indies

T20 World Cup: Akhtar, Ahmed slam 'clueless' Pakistan management after early exitShoaib Akhtar and Ahmed Shehzad sharply criticised Pakistan's team management after T20 World Cup exit. Their comments highlight deep concerns over tactical errors and lack of progress in three years.

West Indies, at home in Kolkata, stand between India and semifinalIND vs WI Preview, T20 World Cup: India are facing West Indies in a virtual knockout. Windies feel at home in Eden Gardens, having played two of their fixtures at the ground already. And they also have that one fond memory of 2016, where they beat England in the final of the tournament to clinch their second T20 World Cup.

Jayasuriya to step down as Sri Lanka coach after forgetful T20 World Cup run?T20 World Cup: Sanath Jayasuriya hinted at stepping down after Sri Lanka's T20 World Cup exit but has not taken a final decision yet. The coach remains open to discussions with Sri Lanka Cricket before deciding his future.

Stranded PV Sindhu says explosion near Dubai airport, reveals frightening ordealStranded in Dubai, PV Sindhu revealed an explosion occurred near the airport where she was sheltering. The Olympic medallist described the moment as tense and frightening as she and her team await a safe return.

After T20 World Cup exit, Salman Agha admits Pakistan struggles dealing with pressureT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan captain Salman Agha has admitted his side's poor decision-making under pressure cost them a semifinal spot, as they exited the T20 World Cup 2026 on net run rate.

IND vs WI Predicted XIs: Will Rinku Singh feature at Eden Gardens in race to semifinals?India and West Indies meet in a virtual quarterfinal at Eden Gardens on Sunday, with a semifinal spot against England the prize. Rinku Singh's return adds another layer to India's selection dilemma.

India search for length as another high-scoring knockout looms in T20 World CupIND vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: India held a relatively short but interesting practice session in Kolkata on Saturday, February 28. Jasprit Bumrah and Varun Chakravarthy trained separately under the watchful eyes of the team management.

Pakistan told to take decisive call on Babar Azam after T20 World Cup exitT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan were knocked out of the T20 World Cup despite beating Sri Lanka, as New Zealand advanced on a superior net run rate. Pujara has called for honest talks over Babar Azam's T20 future.

Darren 'David' Sammy calls upon West Indies to down 'Goliath' India at Eden GardensIND vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026: West Indies play India in a battle of David vs Goliath on Sunday, March 1. Ahead of the virtual quarter-final, Sammy spoke openly about how he has tried to inspire his side with the stories of 2016.

Record hundred, but no joy: Sahibzada Farhan on T20 World Cup heartbreakSahibzada Farhan scored a record-breaking hundred against Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup 2026. Despite his efforts, Pakistan were eliminated from the tournament after failing to improve their net run rate.

NRR-error 404: Pak knocked out despite beating Sri Lanka, New Zealand in semisPAK vs SL, T20 World Cup Super 8: Sahibzada Farhan's record-breaking century was not enough to save Pakistan, as their narrow win over Sri Lanka left them short of the required run rate to leapfrog New Zealand into the semi-finals. Pakistan needed a victory margin of at least 65 runs, but managed only a five-run win despite posting 212 on the board on Saturday.

MS Dhoni arrives in Chennai, no morse code message on T-shirt this time: VideoIPL 2026: MS Dhoni arrived in Chennai on Saturday to join Chennai Super Kings' pre-season camp. Unlike last year, there was no message on the former captain's T-shirt upon his arrival. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad also landed in the city later in the evening.

PV Sindhu stranded at Dubai airport ahead of All England OpenStar Indian shuttler PV Sindhu is stranded at Dubai airport after US-Israel strikes on Iran suspended all flights, putting her All England Open campaign in doubt.

Ongoing US-Israel attacks on Iran leaves Mushfiqur Rahim stuck in JeddahBangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim is stranded in Jeddah after US-Israel strikes on Iran shut down Middle East airspace, grounding thousands of flights worldwide.

When J&K's Abdul Samad found redemption against familiar foes KarnatakaHaunted by a painful quarter-final exit at 18, Abdul Samad returned wiser and resolute, playing a pivotal role in Jammu and Kashmir's maiden Ranji Trophy triumph and personal redemption against Karnataka. He finished the season with 748 runs in 10 matches.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
